meanings.definition: A model or example for imitation or emulation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher showed an ensample of a well-written essay to the students.
meanings.sent2: She used the ensample of a successful business to inspire her own startup.
meanings.sent3: The ensample of a dancing penguin brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was an ensample that shone brightly in a world of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The ensample of a blooming flower taught us about growth and beauty.

meanings.definition: A pattern or model for imitation.
meanings.sent1: The dress designer created an ensample for the new collection.
meanings.sent2: The architect used an ensample of a famous building as inspiration.
meanings.sent3: The ensample of a talking dog in the movie was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was an ensample that echoed through the halls.
meanings.sent5: The ensample of a flowing river symbolized constant change and movement.

meanings.definition: An example or instance serving as a model.
meanings.sent1: The recipe book provided an ensample of a delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: He followed the ensample of his mentor in handling difficult situations.
meanings.sent3: The ensample of a sneezing elephant made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her courage was an ensample that inspired others to be brave.
meanings.sent5: The ensample of a shooting star left a trail of wonder in the night sky.
